definition: season/the last month of a season/fourth or youngest amongst brothers/classifier for seasonal crop yields
to print/to publish/publication/periodical/to peel with a knife/to carve/to amend

sentences.english: A version of this article originally appeared in The McKinsey Quarterly.
sentences.chinese: 本篇文章的另一個版本最先出現在《麥肯錫季刊》上。

sentences.english: He reads all the literary quarterlies .
sentences.chinese: 所有的文學季刊他都看。

sentences.english: A third one was the page of an education quarterly.
sentences.chinese: 還有一個是一家教育季刊網站。

sentences.english: Yishu. Journal of Contemporary Chinese Art.
sentences.chinese: 討論當代亞洲藝術的季刊。

sentences.english: She has edited the media studies quarterly, Screen.
sentences.chinese: 她編選了這本媒體研究季刊&《銀幕》。

sentences.english: MemberExtra! magazine is a quarterly publication of the association sent to all dues-paying members.
sentences.chinese: 雜誌是協會向所有會員收繳會費的季刊。

sentences.english: The 120-page quarterly, which is available online, gives Zhou "a sense of belonging", she said.
sentences.chinese: 她說120頁的在線季刊，給了她“歸屬感”。

sentences.english: A quarterly trade title features full color, large-format illustrations of brand name watches gleaned from around the world.
sentences.chinese: 名錶時尚季刊，薈萃環球知名流行品牌，爲市場導覽。

sentences.english: The research was published this week in the journal School Psychology Quarterly.
sentences.chinese: 這篇研究報告發表在本週的學校心理季刊上。

sentences.english: This is our first issue, and it may or may not meet your expectations.
sentences.chinese: 本季刊之創刊號能否符合你的期望呢？

sentences.english: Philippine Sugar Institute, North Avenue, Diliman , Quezon City, Philippines.
sentences.chinese: 菲律賓製糖學會季刊》刊載製糖技術方面的文章。

definition: to start publishing/to found a journal
old variant of 刊[kan1]/to peel with a knife/to carve/to amend
